intro: Rhynchospora bucherorum, commonly known as the Bucher's sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the wetlands of North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, grasses, and rushes. The plant typically grows in moist to wet soils, often in marshes or along the edges of ponds and lakes. Its flowering stems are triangular in cross-section, a characteristic feature of the sedge family. Rhynchospora bucherorum produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are clustered at the tips of the stems.
